thread.title: Claudia Lawrence's mother opens daughter’s home to cameras | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Claudia Lawrence's mother opens daughter’s home to cameras | Daily Mail Online

author: Rachael Burford For Mailonline
title: Claudia Lawrence's mother opens daughter’s home to cameras | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 211 shares Ms Lawrence said she opened up her daughter's home because she 'can't rest' until she knows what happened. Claudia was last seen walking to her workplace at York University on March 18, 2009. She was reported missing the next day and a huge search campaign ensued. Officers received more than 1,000 calls about Claudia after her father Peter Lawrence appealed for information. By May, 2009 police were treating the case as a suspected murder investigation. Ms Lawrence (pictured right with Claudia left) said she opened up her daughter's home because she 'can't rest' until she knows what happened In January Yorkshire Police announced the investigation into Claudia's disappearance, which has cost more than £1million to date, will be scaled down Claudia was last seen walking (pictured) to her workplace at York University on March 18, 2009. She was reported missing the next day and a huge search campaign ensued In October 2013 officers announced a fresh case review and forensic search of ­Claudia's home. A total six men have been arrested on suspicion of Claudia's murder but no one has ever been charged. In January Yorkshire Police announced the investigation, which has cost more than £1million to date, will be scaled down. Officers received more than 1,000 calls about Claudia after her father, Peter Lawrence (pictured), appealed for information when she disappeared North Yorkshire Assist Chief Constable Paul Kennedy said the case was 'extremely challenging and complex'. He added: 'The case won't be closed until those responsible for Claudia's disappearance and, we believe, her murder, are brought to justice.' The case will be featured in 'Unsolved' on ITV's This Morning at 10.30am. Share or comment on this article 211
